newsitem.title: FRANCE: Rhone-Rorer gets Japan's ok for Taxotere cancer drug.
newsitem.headline: Rhone-Rorer gets Japan's ok for Taxotere cancer drug.

text.p: Franco-American drugs group Rhone-Poulenc Rorer said Monday its new anti-cancer drug Taxotere had obtained market approval in Japan for breast cancer and some lung cancer treatments.

Rorer said Taxotere was the first product of the taxoides class to receive Japanese market authorisation. Taxoides are drugs that fight cancer cells by inhibiting their cell division, causing the cells to die.
Taxotere has already received market authorisation in more than 35 countries.
Rhone-Poulenc Rorer is majority-owned by Rhone-Poulenc of France.
Gary Shearman, senior vice-president for pharmaceutical development, said the drug was approved to treat two of the five most common tumours in Japan.
Rhone-Poulenc's stock edged up 25 cents to $67.75 in early trading on the New York Stock Exchange.
